result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th) .077. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) .077 was dismissed by the court.

  • Wade A. Sivertsen was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $600.00 fine plus costs for a total of $1,819.00.
Can serve on EMP if defendant obtains employment and the jail approves.
Obtain/maintain employment that is acceptable to agent.

Comply with all treatment recommended from AODA assessment.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores.

timeConds.notes:
Can serve on EMP if defendant obtains employment and the jail approves.

Defendant can continue being a trustee if the jail allows it.
